meanings.definition: The practice or profession of examining the eyes for visual defects and prescribing corrective lenses.
meanings.sent1: Optometry helps people see better by checking their eyes and giving them glasses.
meanings.sent2: I visited the optometry clinic to get my eyes checked and buy new glasses.
meanings.sent3: The optometry office was so busy that they had to bring in extra staff to help with all the eye exams.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for optometry was like a clear lens, focusing her career path on helping others see clearly.
meanings.sent5: The optometry exam was like a window into a world of sharper vision and brighter colors.

meanings.definition: The study of the structure, function, and diseases of the eye.
meanings.sent1: In optometry school, students learn about the eyes and how they work.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in optometry are always looking for new ways to improve eye health.
meanings.sent3: The optometry textbook was so interesting that I couldn't put it down.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to optometry was like a guiding light, leading him to discover new insights into eye diseases.
meanings.sent5: The world of optometry is like a puzzle, with each piece representing a different aspect of eye care.
